alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 1:59PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PROLONGED RAINFALL FOR SOUTHWEST ALASKA THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... A low pressure system will move across Southwest Alaska through this weekend and bring heavy rainfall to the region before gradually tapering off throughout the day Sunday. There is high confidence that locations in the Greater Bristol Bay Region, including New Stuyahok and Iliamna, could see over an inch of rainfall tonight through Sunday morning. Areas north and west of Bethel, including Newtok, could see storm totals of around 0.25 to 0.5 inches of rainfall through Sunday morning. In general, higher amounts of precipitation are expected to remain closer to the Western Alaska Range. Due to model discrepancies, there is less confidence in the exact location of locally higher amounts and if total rainfall amounts exceeds two inches. For more information and for your local forecast, please visit weather.gov/anchorage.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
